KnowledgeBase.Title: bmod
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: boolean arithmetic mod remainder division operators

Function.Description: The bmod Function divides two booleans and returns the remainder expressed as a boolean.

Brief.Overview: The bmod function divides two booleans and returns the remainder expressed as a boolean. The bmod function does not perform type checking or type conversion on the operands. Both operands are treated as integers during the mod operation. The result is a Boolean true if and only if the result of the operation is a one; otherwise, the result is a Boolean false.
Brief.Usage: The bmod built-in function is used to determine if a Boolean will divide evenly into another boolean (the remainder will be zero in this case).

Syntax.Return: The remainder after division. The result is expressed as a boolean.
